verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 1:1
verses.text: The Epistle of Ignatius to Hero, a Deacon of Antioch  Ignatius, who is also called Theophorus, to Hero, the deacon of Christ, and the servant of God, a man honoured by God, and most dearly loved as well as esteemed, who carries Christ and the Spirit within him, and who is mine own son in faith and love: Grace, mercy, and peace from Almighty God, and from Christ Jesus our Lord, His only-begotten Son, "who gave Himself for our sins, that He might deliver us from the present evil world," and preserve us unto His heavenly kingdom.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 1:2
verses.text: Chapter 1 — Exhortations to earnestness and moderation.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 1:3
verses.text: I Exhort thee in God, that thou add speed to thy course, and that thou vindicate thy dignity.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 1:4
verses.text: Have a care to preserve concord with the saints.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 1:5
verses.text: Bear the burdens of the weak, that "thou mayest fulfil the law of Christ".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 1:6
verses.text: Devote thyself to fasting and prayer, but not beyond measure, lest thou destroy thyself thereby.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 1:7
verses.text: Do not altogether abstain from wine and flesh, for these things are not to be viewed with abhorrence, since the Scripture saith, "Ye shall eat the good things of the earth".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 1:8
verses.text: And again, "Ye shall eat flesh even as herbs".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 1:9
verses.text: And again, "Wine maketh glad the heart of man, and oil exhilarates, and bread strengthens him".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 1:10
verses.text: But all are to be used with moderation, as being the gifts of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 1:11
verses.text: "For who shall eat or who shall drink without Him? For if anything be beautiful, it is His; and if anything be good, it is His".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 1:12
verses.text: Give attention to reading, that thou mayest not only thyself know the laws, but mayest also explain them to others, as the earnest servant of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 1:13
verses.text: "No man that warreth entangleth himself with the affairs of this life, that he may please him who hath chosen him to be a soldier; and if a man also strive for masteries, yet is he not crowned except he strive lawfully".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 1:14
verses.text: I that am in bonds pray that my soul may be in place of yours.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 2:1
verses.text: Chapter 2 — Cautions against false teachers.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 2:2
verses.text: Every one that teaches anything beyond what is commanded, though he be deemed worthy of credit, though he be in the habit of fasting, though he live in continence, though he work miracles, though he have the gift of prophecy, let him be in thy sight as a wolf in sheep's clothing, labouring for the destruction of the sheep.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 2:3
verses.text: If any one denies the cross, and is ashamed of the passion, let him be to thee as the adversary himself.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 2:4
verses.text: "Though he gives all his goods to feed the poor, though he remove mountains, though he give his body to be burned," let him be regarded by thee as abominable.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 2:5
verses.text: If any one makes light of the law or the prophets, which Christ fulfilled at His coming, let him be to thee as antichrist.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 2:6
verses.text: If any one says that the Lord is a mere man, he is a Jew, a murderer of Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 3:1
verses.text: Chapter 3 — Exhortations as to ecclesiastical duties.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 3:2
verses.text: "Honour widows that are widows indeed".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 3:3
verses.text: Be the friend of orphans; for God is "the Father of the fatherless, and the Judge of the widows".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 3:4
verses.text: Do nothing without the bishops; for they are priests, and thou a servant of the priests.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 3:5
verses.text: They baptize, offer sacrifice, ordain, and lay on hands; but thou ministerest to them, as the holy Stephen did at Jerusalem to James and the presbyters.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 3:6
verses.text: Do not neglect the sacred meetings of the saints; inquire after every one by name.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 3:7
verses.text: "Let no man despise thy youth, but be thou an example to the believers, both in word and conduct".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 4:1
verses.text: Chapter 4 — Servants and women are not to be despised.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 4:2
verses.text: Be not ashamed of servants, for we possess the same nature in common with them.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 4:3
verses.text: Do not hold women in abomination, for they have given thee birth, and brought thee up.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 4:4
verses.text: It is fitting, therefore, to love those that were the authors of our birth (but only in the Lord), inasmuch as a man can produce no children without a woman.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 4:5
verses.text: It is right, therefore, that we should honour those who have had a part in giving us birth.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 4:6
verses.text: "Neither is the man without the woman, nor the woman without the man," except in the case of those who were first formed.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 4:7
verses.text: For the body of Adam was made out of the four elements, and that of Eve out of the side of Adam.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 4:8
verses.text: And, indeed, the altogether peculiar birth of the Lord was of a virgin alone.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 4:9
verses.text: This took place not as if the lawful union of man and wife were abominable, but such a kind of birth was fitting to God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 4:10
verses.text: For it became the Creator not to make use of the ordinary method of generation, but of one that was singular and strange, as being the Creator.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 5:1
verses.text: Chapter 5 — Various relative duties.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 5:2
verses.text: Flee from haughtiness, "for the Lord resisteth the proud".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 5:3
verses.text: Abhor falsehood, for says the Scripture, "Thou shalt destroy all them that speak lies".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 5:4
verses.text: Guard against envy, for its author is the devil, and his successor Cain, who envied his brother, and out of envy committed murder.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 5:5
verses.text: Exhort my sisters to love God, and be content with their own husbands only.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 5:6
verses.text: In like manner, exhort my brethren also to be content with their own wives.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 5:7
verses.text: Watch over the virgins, as the precious treasures of Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 5:8
verses.text: Be long-suffering, that thou mayest be great in wisdom.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 5:9
verses.text: Do not neglect the poor, in so far as thou art prosperous.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 5:10
verses.text: For "by alms and fidelity sins are purged away".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 6:1
verses.text: Chapter 6 —Exhortations to purity and caution.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 6:2
verses.text: Keep thyself pure as the habitation of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 6:3
verses.text: Thou art the temple of Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 6:4
verses.text: Thou art the instrument of the Spirit.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 6:5
verses.text: Thou knowest in what way I have brought thee up.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 6:6
verses.text: Though I am the least of men, do thou seek to follow me, be thou an imitator of my conduct.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 6:7
verses.text: I do not glory in the world, but in the Lord.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 6:8
verses.text: I exhort Hero, my son; "but let him that glorieth, glory in the Lord".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 6:9
verses.text: May I have joy of thee, my dear son, whose guardian may He be who is the only unbegotten God, and the Lord Jesus Christ! Do not believe all persons, do not place confidence in all; nor let any man get the better of thee by flattery.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 6:10
verses.text: For many are the ministers of Satan; and "he that is hasty to believe is light of heart".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 7:1
verses.text: Chapter 7 — Solemn charge to Hero, as future bishop of Antioch.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 7:2
verses.text: Keep God in remembrance, and thou shalt never sin.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 7:3
verses.text: Be not double-minded in thy prayers; for blessed is he who doubteth not.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 7:4
verses.text: For I believe in the Father of the Lord Jesus Christ, and in His only-begotten Son, that God will show me, Hero, upon my throne.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 7:5
verses.text: Add speed, therefore, to thy course.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 7:6
verses.text: I charge thee before the God of the universe, and before Christ, and in the presence of the Holy Spirit, and of the ministering ranks of angels, keep in safety that deposit which I and Christ have committed to thee, and do not judge thyself unworthy of those things which have been shown by God to me concerning thee.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 7:7
verses.text: I hand over to thee the Church of Antioch.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 7:8
verses.text: I have commended you to Polycarp in the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 8:1
verses.text: Chapter 8 — Salutations.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 8:2
verses.text: The bishops, Onesimus, Bitus, Damas, Polybius, and all they of Philippi (whence also I have written to thee), salute thee in Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 8:3
verses.text: Salute the presbytery worthy of God: salute my holy fellow-deacons, of whom may I have joy in Christ, both in the flesh and in the spirit.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 8:4
verses.text: Salute the people of the Lord, from the smallest to the greatest, every one by name; whom I commit to thee as Moses did the Israelites to Joshua, who was their leader after him.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 8:5
verses.text: And do not reckon this which I have said presumptuous on my part; for although we are not such as they were, yet we at least pray that we may be so, since indeed we are the children of Abraham.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 8:6
verses.text: Be strong, therefore, O Hero, like a hero, and like a man.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 8:7
verses.text: For from henceforth thou shalt lead in and out the people of the Lord that are in Antioch, and so "the congregation of the Lord shall not be as sheep which have no shepherd".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 9:1
verses.text: Chapter 9 — Concluding salutations and instructions.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 9:2
verses.text: Salute Cassian, my host, and his most serious-minded partner in life, and their very dear children, to whom may "God grant that they find mercy of the Lord in that day," on account of their ministrations to us, whom also I commend to thee in Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 9:3
verses.text: Salute by name all the faithful in Christ that are at Laodicea.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 9:4
verses.text: Do not neglect those at Tarsus, but look after them steadily, confirming them in the Gospel.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 9:5
verses.text: I salute in the Lord, Maris the bishop of Neapolis, near Anazarbus.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 9:6
verses.text: Salute thou also Mary my daughter, distinguished both for gravity and erudition, as also "the Church which is in her house".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 9:7
verses.text: May my soul be in place of hers: she is the very pattern of pious women.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Hero 9:8
verses.text: May the Father of Christ, by His only-begotten Son, preserve thee in good health, and of high repute in all things, to a very old age, for the benefit of the Church of God! Farewell in the Lord, and pray thou that I may be perfected.
